dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 91 IH: To extend the supplemental security income benefits program to Guam, the United States Virgin Islands, and American Samoa.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mrs. Christensen (for herself, Ms. Bordallo, and Mr. Faleomavaega) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To extend the supplemental security income benefits program to Guam, the United States Virgin Islands, and American Samoa.

section.header: Extension of the Supplemental Security Income benefits program to Guam, the United States Virgin Islands, and American Samoa

subsection.text: Section 1101(a)(1) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1301(a)(1)) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: by striking title IV and inserting titles IV and XVI (as in effect pursuant to such amendment after December 31, 1973).
Section 303(b) of the Social Security Amendments of 1972 (86 Stat. 1484) is amended by striking , Guam, and the Virgin Islands.
Sections 3(a)(2), 1003(a)(2), 1403(a)(2), and 1603(a)(2) of such Act (42 U.S.C. 303(a)(2), 1203(a)(2), 1353(a)(2), and 1383 note) are each amended by striking , the Virgin Islands, and Guam.
Section 1614(e) of such Act (42 U.S.C. 1382c(e)) is amended by striking and the District of Columbia and inserting , the District of Columbia, the Virgin Islands, Guam, and American Samoa.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall take effect on the 1st day of the 3rd calendar month that begins after the date of the enactment of this Act.
